intro: Myrsine mcphersonii, commonly known as the McPherson's myrsine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces red berries that are an important food source for native birds. Myrsine mcphersonii is typically found in forest understories and is adapted to the moist, shaded environments of its native habitat.
